name: P√≥lya Problem Solving
description: George P√≥lya's systematic four-step approach to mathematical and general problem-solving

steps.name: Understand the Problem - Clarify what you're solving
steps.description:
Deeply understand what the problem is asking before attempting to solve it

üß† ENHANCED THINKING REQUIRED: Use the SequentialThinking tool to work through this systematically.

Systematically explore the problem:
‚Ä¢ What is the unknown? What are we trying to find or prove?
‚Ä¢ What are the data? What information is given?
‚Ä¢ What is the condition? What constraints or requirements must be satisfied?
‚Ä¢ Can you restate the problem in your own words?
‚Ä¢ Can you think of a picture or diagram that might help?
‚Ä¢ Is there enough information to enable you to find a solution?
‚Ä¢ Is there redundant or contradictory information?
‚Ä¢ Have you seen a problem similar to this before?

steps.name: Devise a Plan - Find the connection between data and unknown
steps.description:
Develop a strategy for solving the problem using various heuristics

üß† ENHANCED THINKING REQUIRED: Use the SequentialThinking tool to work through this systematically.

Explore solution strategies:
‚Ä¢ Have you seen this problem before in a slightly different form?
‚Ä¢ Do you know a related problem? A similar theorem or principle?
‚Ä¢ Look at the unknown! Think of a familiar problem with the same or similar unknown
‚Ä¢ Could you restate the problem differently? More general? More special? Analogous?
‚Ä¢ Could you solve a part of the problem? Keep only part of the condition?
‚Ä¢ Could you derive something useful from the data?
‚Ä¢ Could you change the unknown or data to get closer to a solution?
‚Ä¢ Did you use all the data? The whole condition?

Consider these strategies:
‚Ä¢ Work backward from the desired result
‚Ä¢ Look for a pattern
‚Ä¢ Solve a simpler analogous problem
‚Ä¢ Use symmetry or special cases
‚Ä¢ Consider extreme cases
‚Ä¢ Make a systematic list
‚Ä¢ Draw a picture or diagram
‚Ä¢ Use a formula or known result

steps.name: Carry Out the Plan - Implement your strategy with patience
steps.description:
Execute your chosen strategy step by step

üß† ENHANCED THINKING REQUIRED: Use the SequentialThinking tool to work through this systematically.

Implement the solution:
‚Ä¢ Execute each step of your plan carefully
‚Ä¢ Check each step - can you see clearly that it's correct?
‚Ä¢ Can you prove that each step is correct?
‚Ä¢ If the plan isn't working, be patient but willing to try another approach
‚Ä¢ Don't give up too quickly, but don't persist with a failing strategy
‚Ä¢ Keep track of what you've tried and why it didn't work
‚Ä¢ Look for computational errors or logical gaps
‚Ä¢ Maintain clear notation and organization

steps.name: Look Back - Review and extend your solution
steps.description:
Examine the solution and consider improvements or generalizations

üß† ENHANCED THINKING REQUIRED: Use the SequentialThinking tool to work through this systematically.

Reflect on the solution:
‚Ä¢ Can you check the result? Can you verify it's correct?
‚Ä¢ Can you check the argument? Are all steps valid?
‚Ä¢ Can you derive the result differently? Can you see it at a glance?
‚Ä¢ Can you use the result or method for other problems?
‚Ä¢ What made this problem difficult? What was the key insight?
‚Ä¢ Could you have solved it more elegantly or efficiently?
‚Ä¢ What did you learn that could help with future problems?
‚Ä¢ Can you generalize the solution to a broader class of problems?
‚Ä¢ Are there related problems you could now solve?
